[[File:Father Francis Morgan 8 August 19: On [[8 August]] [[1904]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"

*'''Description:''' The letter, a "remarkable code letter" written by the 12-year-old Tolkien, is kept at the [[Bodleian Library]] in [[Oxford]], and ends with the limerick seen below.<ref>"The AB Language Lives" by [[Arne Zettersten]] in ''[[The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien
First page of the letter: The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien: Drawings and Original Manuscripts from the Marquette University Collection]]'' (2004)</ref>

[[File:Father Francis Morgan 8 August 19: *'''Publication:''' An excerpt of the letter was published in ''[[The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien
First page of the letter: The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien: Drawings and Original Manuscripts from the Marquette University Collection]]''.

[[File:Father Francis Morgan 8 August 19: There was an old priest named Francis
Who was so fond of "cheefongy" dances
That he sat up too late
